subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit How to run the same test with different data (how about Cactus)
msgSnippet: ... Another less elegant solution is to simply do your own comparison instead of the assertEquals, store any failures in an Array or somesuch, then, at the end
messageBody:
zoran_101 wrote:

>Thanks, this helped a lot, and also I happen to have the JUnit
>Recepies book so I just looked it up. However it looks like that I
>will have to run my tests in a container, meaning I have to use
>Cactus. I don't think I can do this with Cactus because they
>instantiate TestCase. If there is a way I would love to know.
>
>
Another less elegant solution is to simply do your own comparison
instead of the assertEquals, store any failures in an Array or somesuch,
then, at the end of the whole loop, assertEquals that the problem array
is empty, dumping the contents of the array into the message param.

--
Chris
http://clabs.org
